message.content:
Day 1:
Breakfast: Fruit salad with mixed berries (strawberries, blueberries, blackberries, and raspberries) topped with chopped banana and kiwi.
Lunch: Quinoa salad with cucumber, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, olives, and fresh herbs like parsley and cilantro. Dressing made of lemon juice, extra virgin olive oil, and a pinch of salt.
Dinner: Vegan stir-fry with tofu, mixed vegetables (broccoli, carrots, mushrooms), served over brown rice with a side of steamed spinach.
Snack: A slice of watermelon or apple.

Day 2:
Breakfast: Smoothie made from a combination of mango, pineapple, and coconut milk.
Lunch: Large salad of mixed greens, avocado, chickpeas, red onion, cherry tomatoes, and bell peppers. Dressing made with extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper.
Dinner: Vegan lentil soup with carrots, celery, and fresh parsley. Serve with whole grain bread.
Snack: Handful of raisins or dried apricots.

Day 3:
Breakfast: Chia seed pudding made with coconut milk, topped with fresh berries and a drizzle of maple syrup.
Lunch: Tofu and vegetable wrap with spinach, tomato, cucumber, bell peppers, and tahini sauce (made from blended sesame seeds, garlic, lemon juice, and water).
Dinner: Vegan pasta dish with zucchini noodles, marinara sauce, and black olives. Serve with a side of steamed broccoli.
Snack: Handful of fresh blueberries or strawberries.

Day 4:
Breakfast: Oatmeal cooked in water or almond milk, topped with sliced banana, raisins, and cinnamon.
Lunch: Quinoa tabbouleh salad with parsley, mint, cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and a lemon vinaigrette (extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, minced garlic, salt, and pepper).
Dinner: Baked sweet potato topped with black beans, salsa, and avocado.
Snack: A small handful of pumpkin seeds or sunflower seeds.

Day 5:
Breakfast: Banana nice cream (frozen bananas blended until creamy) topped with chopped almonds or walnuts.
Lunch: Vegan lentil salad with chickpeas, cherry tomatoes, bell peppers, red onion, and fresh herbs like parsley and cilantro. Dressing made of extra virgin olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Dinner: Baked tempeh with teriyaki sauce (made from soy sauce, maple syrup, garlic, and rice vinegar) served over brown rice with steamed broccoli on the side.
Snack: Sliced apple with peanut butter or sunflower seed butter.

Day 6:
Breakfast: Green smoothie made from a combination of spinach, mango, pineapple, and coconut milk.
Lunch: Avo-cucumber salad with avocado, cucumber, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and fresh mint in a lemon vinaigrette. Serve over mixed greens.
Dinner: Vegan pizza with whole grain crust, marinara sauce, veggie toppings (mushrooms, bell peppers, olives), and vegan cheese (made from nuts or seeds).
Snack: Handful of fresh raspberries or blackberries.

Day 7:
Breakfast: Vegan chia seed pudding with coconut milk, topped with sliced strawberries and a drizzle of maple syrup.
Lunch: Kale salad with massaged kale, chickpeas, tomatoes, bell peppers, olives, feta cheese (substitute with vegan feta), and a lemon vinaigrette.
Dinner: Vegan black bean burger on whole grain bun with avocado, lettuce, tomato, and red onion. Serve with sweet potato fries or baked yam.
Snack: A small handful of dried cranberries or blueberries.
